intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. triesenense, commonly known as the Trysenense hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has basal rosettes of leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic differences from other members of the *Hieracium* genus.
